results.title: Op hop, op hop
results.creator_credit: Pierre Heberrt and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A hand-made, scratched-on film experiment in intermittent animation. The images are a group of twenty-four visuals, all non-representational, which arrange and rearrange on the screen in many combinations. The result is a changing pattern of sound and image that has its own rhythm for eye and ear.

results.title: Oops those Hollywood bloopers
results.brief_description: A collection of bloopers and outtakes from an enormous selection of Hollywood classic productions spanning from the 1930’s right through to the 1980’s. Includes Ronald Reagan ‘Pants Down’, Errol Flynn ‘Mobbed in the Men’s Bath Tub’, Humphrey Bogart, Cary Grant, James Stewart, Bette Davis, Joan Crawford, Sammy Davis Jr., Tony Randall, Tiny Tim, Glenn Campbell (who’s overwhelmed by a black male dancer), Don Adams, Don Knotts, Anita Bryant, Christopher Lee, Dick Foran, Ben Gazzara, Marilyn Monroe, Debbie Reynolds, Boris Karloff plus many many more. This compilation also includes footage of the Beatles, Elvis, Diana Ross, Hitler doing a jig and the inclusion of short animation ‘Bambi meets Godzilla’ by Marv Newland. Please note: The use of rare film sources presents moments of variable picture and sound quality.

results.title: Oondamooroo: a profile of Ernie Dingo (A)
results.creator_credit: Don Featherstone, Don Featherstone Productions and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description: The Aboriginal actor Ernie Dingo talks about his career, his origins, influences on his life and his feelings about his aboriginality. Features excerpts from his work on stage and screen, interviews with friends, mentors, family and wife and shows him at work teaching Aboriginal children to develop self-respect and white children to understand Aboriginal culture and history. An engaging look at an impressive and likeable personality.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don Featherstone, Don Featherstone Productions and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service

results.title: Only you
results.creator_credit: Norman Jewison, Charles Mulvehill, Robert N. Fried, Gary Woods, Tri-Star Pictures, Yorktown Productions Ltd and Fried Woods Films
results.brief_description: This very romantic comedy is all about a girl named Faith (Marisa Tomei) who searches for her “soul mate” named Damon Bradley. She was advised of this name by the Ouija board and a gypsy fortune teller. A week before her wedding, “Damon” phones to say he is unable to attend. Faith believes she must leave her fiancee, travel to Italy, and find her date with destiny”. During her search, the wrong man (Robert Downy Jnr) falls madly in love with her. What is she to do? With breathless scenery and brilliant performances, it’s irresistible entertainment that everyone will enjoy. Cast also includes Billy Zane and Fisher Stevens.

results.title: Only when I laugh
results.creator_credit: Glenn Jordan, Neil Simon, Roger M Rothstein and Colubia Pictures Industries
results.brief_description: A bittersweet Neil Simon comedy about alcoholic Broadway actress, Georgia Hines’ (Marsha Mason), struggle to remain sober and who six years earlier relinquished custody of her daughter Polly (Kristy McNichol) in order to “straighten out her life.” Georgia is about to star in a play about her turbulent romantic past, when Polly decides to move in. There are good times, pretending to be sisters to confuse a pair of college boys, and there are tough times, when they confront the past and the truth about the lost years. Through it all, with humour and warmth, they come to know one another again. Superior performances by James Coco as a gay failed actor, Joan Hackett as an aging Park Avenue beauty, Georgia’s “perennially out-of-work” friends, and David Dukes as boyfriend David. Screenplay by Neil Simon, loosley based on his play “The Gingerbread Lady.”

results.title: Only two wheels
results.creator_credit: Ron Saunders, Terry Jennings and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Emphasizing the importance of motor cycle riders seeing and being seen, this film highlights a variety of problems that normally confront the motor cyclist - lane changing, hazards on the road, car blind spots, careless pedestrians and emergency braking.

results.title: Only two can play
results.creator_credit: Sidney Gilliat, Leslie Gilliat, British Lion Films and Frank Launder
results.brief_description: Classic black and white British comedy from the 1960s starring the indomitable Peter Sellers as a lusty (but married) Welsh librarian. Set in Aberdarcy Wales, the Public Library is visited by the chairman’s wife (Mai Zetterling) in search of picture books to research costume design for the Aberdarcy Players new amateur theatrical. She flirts shamelessly with the librarian John Lewis (Sellers) and they attempt to have an affair. His potential for job promotion and his marriage seem to be in jeopardy as a result. Richard Attenborough has a guest appearance as a rival for his wife’s (Virginia Maskell) affections. A witty plot filled with as many cigarettes as sharp one-liners, a delightful film. Based on the novel “That uncertain feeling” by Kinsley Amis.

results.title: Only the Brave
results.creator_credit: Ana Kokkinos, Fiona Eagger and Pickpocket Productions
results.brief_description: Alex (Elena Mandalis) and Vicki (Dora Kaskanis) are two young Greek Australian girls in Melbourne’s western suburbs. Only together - committing arson, hanging out - do they find moments of peace in their lives.

constellations_other.name: Ana Kokkinos
constellations_other.description: The films and TV works of Ana Kokkinos often explore the experiences of second-generation Australians, queer identities and class. Since beginning her career in the early 90s, those stories have started to appear more frequently on Australian screens.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Ana Kokkinos, Fiona Eagger and Pickpocket Productions
results.description: Alex (Elena Mandalis) and Vicki (Dora Kaskanis) are two young Greek Australian girls in Melbourne’s western suburbs. Vicki is bored with school and she is abused by her father at home. Alex misses her estranged mother and is trying to deal with her growing sexual attraction to a female teacher (well played by Maude Davey). Only together - committing arson, hanging out - do they find moments of peace in their lives. This tough short film is an outstanding example of a recent Australian cinema. Weaving themes of sexuality, ethnicity and dislocation, “Only the Brave” manages to be realist and elegiac, sensitive and uncompromising, and show how the impact of migration has altered the tradition, landscape and narratives of Australian culture. Mandalis and Kaskanis are knock-outs in their first screen performances and the the film received an AFI Award for best short film and the Audience Award at the Sundance Film Festival. Written by Ana Kokkinos and Mira Robertson.
description_for_label: Alex (Elena Mandalis) and Vicki (Dora Kaskanis) are two young Greek Australian girls in Melbourne’s western suburbs. Vicki is bored with school and she is abused by her father at home. Alex misses her estranged mother and is trying to deal with her growing sexual attraction to a female teacher (well played by Maude Davey). Only together - committing arson, hanging out - do they find moments of peace in their lives. This tough short film is an outstanding example of a recent Australian cinema. Weaving themes of sexuality, ethnicity and dislocation, “Only the Brave” manages to be realist and elegiac, sensitive and uncompromising, and show how the impact of migration has altered the tradition, landscape and narratives of Australian culture. Mandalis and Kaskanis are knock-outs in their first screen performances and the the film received an AFI Award for best short film and the Audience Award at the Sundance Film Festival. Written by Ana Kokkinos and Mira Robertson.

results.title: Only ten pints
results.creator_credit: St John Ambulance Australia and British Petroleum
results.brief_description: The fear of blood can be easily dispelled and people can learn what to do in case of an amergency…in a First Aid Class. Clear diagrams and commentary show how lives may be saved when an accident causes any type of haemorrhage.

results.title: Only Sound Remains
results.creator_credit: Arash Ashtiani, Anshu Poddar and London Film School
results.brief_description: In the wake of the violent post-election protests in Iran, a man and his wife, Babak and Nahid, try to hide the devastating news from Babak’s grandmother that his brother is missing.
